title: Rams debut live feed of their Inglewood stadium construction site - Rams Wire
text:
Rams debut live feed of their Inglewood stadium construction site Rams debut live feed of their Inglewood stadium construction site By Tanya Ray Fox 12 hours ago 186 shares By: Tanya Ray Fox | 12 hours ago 
You may not have asked for it, or ever even considering needing it, but have no fear because the Los Angeles Rams live feed of their stadium construction is here! Live construction feed launched for the L.A. Stadium & Entertainment District at Hollywood Park ⚠️ 
— Los Angeles Rams (@RamsNFL) February 23, 2017 
The massive project known as the L.A. Stadium and Entertainment District at Hollywood park broke ground back in November of 2016, and now the team is giving the public a chance to following along with the progress. 
Not only can you view a live construction feed, there are also HD panorama views and a time lapse video. 
Set to open in 2019, the $2.6 billion stadium and its surrounding amenities and attractions will serve as home base for the Rams and the Los Angeles Chargers, but Rams owner Stan Kroenke envisions it becoming far more than the best place in America to go watch a football game. 
Here’s the Rams video illustrating their vision for the site, complete with 3D renderings:
